{{pp-pc1}} {{Use mdy dates|date=September 2012}} {{Infobox mass murderer | name = James Eagan Holmes | image = James_Holmes,_cropped.jpg | image_size = | caption = Holmes' [[mug shot]] at Arapahoe
County Jail after his arrest | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1987|12|13}} | birth_place = [[San Diego]], [[California]], U.S. | other_names = | education = [[Bachelor of Science|B.S.]] [[Neuroscience]]{{cite news | work = UCR Today | title = Information regarding James Eagan Holmes | author = Ross French | date = July 20, 2012 | accessdate =August 2, 2012 | url = http://ucrtoday.ucr.edu/7775 | publisher = University of California, Riverside }} | alma_mater = {{plainlist | * [[University of California, Riverside]] * [[University of Colorado, Denver]] (incomplete [[Doctor of Philosophy|Ph.D.]] program) }} | known_for = Perpetrator of the [[2012 Aurora shooting]] | criminal_charge = 24 counts of [[first degree murder]]
140 counts of [[attempted murder|attempted first degree murder]]
1 count of possessing an illegal [[explosive device]]
1 sentence enhancement of a crime of violence{{cite web|first=Joshua|last=Barajas|url=http://www.pbs.org/newshour/rundown/3-years-aurora-theater-shooting-james-holmes-trial-set-begin/|title='Through this door is horror': Opening statements begin in theater shooting trial|work=[[PBS News Hour]]''|date=April 27, 2015|accessdate=April 27, 2015}} | criminal_penalty = 12 life sentences in prison without the possibility of parole, and an additional 3,318 years{{cite web|last=Healy|first=Jack|title=A Life Sentence for James Holmes, Aurora Theater Gunman Who Killed 12|publisher=The New York Times|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/08/08/us/jury-decides-fate-of-james-holmes-aurora-theater-gunman.html|date=August 7, 2015|accessdate=August 7, 2015}}{{cite web|url=https://news.yahoo.com/theater-shooting-verdict-colorado-jurors-decide-james-holmes-punishment-211031263.html|title=Theater shooting verdict: James Holmes sentenced to life in prison|work=Yahoo! News|date=August 7, 2015|accessdate=August 7, 2015|first=Jason|last=Sickles}}{{cite web|last=Hickey|first=Chuck|url=http://kdvr.com/2015/08/26/max-aurora-theater-shooter-gets-12-life-sentences-plus-3318-years/|title=Max: Aurora theater shooter gets 12 counts of murder, 70 counts of attempted murder which was granted as life with no parole plus 3,138 years.|publisher=[[FOX31]]|date=August 26, 2015|accessdate=August 26, 2015}} | criminal_status = Incarcerated | website = }} '''James Eagan Holmes''' (born December 13, 1987) is an American convicted murderer responsible for the [[2012 Aurora shooting]] in which he killed 12 people and injured 70 others at a [[Century Theatres|Century 16]] [[movie theater]] in [[Aurora, Colorado]] on July 20, 2012.{{cite news | url = http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-201_162-57476636/colo-shooting-suspect-james-holmes-apartment-booby-trapped-police-say/ | title = Colo. shooting suspect James Holmes' apartment booby trapped, police say | publisher = CBS News | date = July 20, 2012 | accessdate =July 20, 2012}} He had no known criminal background before the shooting occurred. Holmes [[booby-trap]]ped his apartment with explosives before the shooting, which were defused one day later by a bomb squad. Holmes was arrested shortly after the shooting and was jailed without bail while awaiting trial. Following this, he was hospitalized after attempting suicide several times while in jail. Holmes entered a plea of [[Insanity defense|not guilty by reason of insanity]], which was accepted. His trial began on April 27, 2015,{{cite web|url=http://www.9news.com/story/news/2015/04/26/aurora-theater-shooting-trial/26433795/|title=Aurora theater shooting trial adjourns for day|author=Raquel Villanueva and Associated Press, news source|date=April 26, 2015|publisher=[[KUSA (TV)|9News]]}}{{Dead link|date=November 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}{{cite news|last=Muskal |first=Michael |title=Judge allows plea of not guilty by insanity for James Holmes |url=http://www.latimes.com/news/nation/nationnow/la-na-nn-aurora-james-holmes-judge-allows-not-guilty-by-insanity-plea-20130604,0,6032985.story |work=LA Times |accessdate=4 June 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130604233854/http://www.latimes.com/news/nation/nationnow/la-na-nn-aurora-james-holmes-judge-allows-not-guilty-by-insanity-plea-20130604,0,6032985.story |archivedate=June 4, 2013 }} and on August 24 he was sentenced to 12 consecutive life sentences plus 3,318 years without parole. ==Personal life== Holmes was born on December 13, 1987, in [[San Diego]], [[California]]. His father is a mathematician and scientist with degrees from [[Stanford University]], [[UCLA]] and [[UC Berkeley]] and his mother is a [[registered nurse]]. He has one sister.{{cite news | url = http://www.nbcsandiego.com/news/local/James-Holmes-Family-Statement-San-Diego-Shooting-Suspect-163440756.html | title = Holmes Family Stands by Son: Attorney | first1= R. |last1= Stickney |first2= Wendy |last2= Fry |publisher = [[NBC]] San Diego| date = July 24, 2012 | accessdate = January 14, 2013}} Holmes was raised in [[Oak Hills, Monterey County, California|Oak Hills]], a community near [[Castroville, California]], where he attended elementary school.{{cite web|first=Daniel|last=Wallis|first2=Keith|last2=Coffman|url=https://news.yahoo.com/water-parks-piano-class-colorado-movie-gunmans-childhood-101526865.html|title=Water parks and piano class: Colorado movie gunman's childhood|date=July 29, 2015|work=[[Yahoo! News]]|accessdate=July 30, 2015}}{{cite news|title=Castroville classmates stunned: As a youth James Holmes was 'friends with everybody'|newspaper=[[The Salinas Californian]] |url= http://www.thecalifornian.com/article/20120723/NEWS01/307230011/Castroville-classmates-stunned-youth-James-Holmes-friends-everybody-?odyssey=mod{{!}}mostview|date=July 23, 2012}} At twelve years old, Holmes moved back to San Diego. There, he lived in the [[Rancho Peñasquitos, San Diego|Rancho Peñasquitos]] neighborhood, where he reportedly began to decline socially.{{cite web|url=http://www.cnn.com/2015/08/02/us/13th-juror-james-holmes-aurora-shooting/|title=From happy boy to mass murderer: James Holmes' life story weighed by jury|work=CNN|date=August 3, 2015|accessdate=August 3, 2015|first=Ann|last=O'Neill}} He went to [[Westview High School (San Diego)|Westview High School]] and graduated in 2006.{{cite news| author = Susan Gembrowski, Marisol Bello and Trevor Hughes| title =A closer look at Aurora shooting suspect James Holmes| quote =His family still lives in the two-story white house with a red-tiled roof where he grew up. The house is less than three miles from Westview High School where he graduated in 2006.| newspaper =[[USA Today]]| date =July 21, 2012| url =http://usatoday30.usatoday.com/news/nation/story/2012-07-20/colorado-shooting-holmes/56373668/1| accessdate =January 19, 2015}} Holmes played soccer and [[Cross country running|ran cross-country]] in high school. He attended Penasquitos Lutheran Church with his family, according to the [[Lutheran]] church's pastor. According to Holmes' lawyer, Daniel King, Holmes began to suffer from mental health issues in middle school and attempted suicide at age 11.{{cite news| author =[[Associated Press]]| title =The Latest: Courthouse empties after Day 1 of Holmes trial| quote = Daniel King said during opening statements Monday that Holmes was a normal child through elementary school but began to have mental health problems in middle school. He says Holmes attempted suicide in 1999.| newspaper =[[Associated Press]]| date = April 27, 2015| url =http://bigstory.ap.org/article/460d1a4541634e538a6161b857d2799b/latest-theater-shooters-parents-arrive-courthouse| accessdate =April 27, 2015}}{{cite news| author =Raquel Villanueva and [[Associated Press]]| title =Aurora theater shooting trial adjourns for day| quote =Daniel King said during opening statements Monday that Holmes was a normal child through elementary school but began to have mental health problems in middle school. He says Holmes attempted suicide at age 11.| newspaper =[[KUSA (TV)|9 News]]| date =April 27, 2015| url =http://www.9news.com/story/news/2015/04/26/aurora-theater-shooting-trial/26433795/| accessdate =April 27, 2015}}{{Dead link|date=November 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} According to Holmes, during his childhood, he was frightened of what he called "Nail Ghosts" that would hammer on the walls at night. He would also see shadows and "flickers" at the corners of his eyes, which would fight each other with firearms and other weapons. Holmes saw social worker Margaret Roth once before she sent him to psychiatrist Lynne Fenton.{{cite web|url=http://abcnews.go.com/US/aurora-shooting-trial-10-things-22-hours-james/story?id=31540740|title=Aurora Shooting Trial: 10 New Things From 22 Hours of James Holmes Psychiatric Evaluation Interviews|work=ABC News|date=June 5, 2015|accessdate=June 5, 2015}} Holmes was depressed and "obsessed with killing for over a decade". In Aurora, Holmes lived on Paris Street in a one-bedroom apartment, in a building with other students involved in health studies. In a rental application for an apartment, he described himself as "quiet and easygoing",{{cite web|publisher=ABC News|date= July 21, 2012| url= http://usnews.msnbc.msn.com/_news/2012/07/20/12854157-aurora-suspect-james-holmes-was-buying-guns-dropping-out-of-graduate-school?lite|title=Aurora suspect James Holmes was buying guns, dropping out of graduate school | first1= Pete |last1= Williams |first2= Bill |last2= Dedman |last3= NBC News staff |accessdate=July 23, 2012}} and in an online dating profile, Holmes identified himself as an [[agnostic]].{{cite web|url=http://www.businessinsider.com/alleged-shooter-james-holmes-bragged-of-soul-penetrating-eyes-on-dating-website-2012-7|title=Alleged Shooter James Holmes Bragged Of 'Soul Penetrating Eyes' On Dating Website|last=Rogers|first=Abby|date=23 July 2012|publisher=[[Business Insider]]|language=English|accessdate=9 September 2016|quote=In his profile, Holmes described himself as an agnostic man who "definitely" wants kids, only drinks "socially," and doesn't smoke.}} He left some [[digital footprint]]s, like a university email address, an old [[Myspace]] photo, a dating profile on [[Match.com]], and a profile on [[Adult FriendFinder]], as well as a [[résumé]] at the employment website [[Monster.com]].{{cite news| url= http://www.pe.com/local-news/local-news-headlines/20120720-colorado-suspect-is-ucr-graduate-boobytrapped-apartment-dismantled.ece |title= At UC Riverside, Holmes led enigmatic life |first1= John |last1= Asbury |first2= Debra |last2= Gruszecki |first3= Alicia |last3= Robinson|newspaper= [[The Press-Enterprise (California)|The Press-Enterprise]] |date=20 July 2012| accessdate= 13 June 2013}} According to a few sources, Holmes allegedly hired prostitutes and left reviews of them on an online [[Internet forum|message board]].{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2181025/James-Holmes-Denver-Dark-Knight-killer-paid-prostitute-sex-just-week-massacre.html |title=James Holmes: Denver Dark Knight killer paid prostitute for sex just a week before massacre |publisher=[[Daily Mail]] |date=2012-07-30 |accessdate=2012-11-03 |location=London}}{{cite news|first=Philip | last= Caulfield |url= http://articles.nydailynews.com/2012-07-25/news/32853154_1_dark-knight-rises-batman-star-christian-bale-tmz |title=Aurora suspect hired prostitutes | newspaper=New York Daily News |date=25 July 2012 |accessdate=2012-11-03}}{{cite news|first1=Matt |last1= Lysiak |first2= Ben | last2= Chapman |url= http://articles.nydailynews.com/2012-07-30/news/32927540_1_roxanna-prostitute-james-holmes |title=Holmes wasn't hot for prostitute|newspaper=New York Daily News |date=30 July 2012 |accessdate=2012-11-03}} In October 2011, Holmes began dating a fellow student in his biology class, Gargi Datta.{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/06/12/us/at-james-homes-colorado-theater-shooting-trial-ex-girlfriend-recalls-unnerving-comments.html?_r=0|title=James Holmes's Ex-Girlfriend Recalls Awkwardness and Ghoulish Remarks|last=Healy|first=Jack|date=11 June 2015|publisher=[[The New York Times]]|language=English|accessdate=8 September 2016}} Their relationship lasted for about two months and ended when she felt distant from him following an encounter between Holmes and another man who talked to her during a date on [[Saint Patrick's Day]]. According to her, Holmes often made flat jokes that made other people feel uncomfortable and had also expressed his desire to kill people. She tried to recommend getting professional help despite not taking his claims seriously. They resumed their relationship in early January 2012, but it ended again in February.{{cite web|url=http://abcnews.go.com/US/james-holmes-love-testify-aurora-shooting-trial/story?id=31672011|title=James Holmes Took First Love to Horror Movie Fest, She Testifies in Aurora Trial|work=ABC News|date=June 10, 2015|accessdate=June 10, 2015}}{{cite web|url=http://www.thedenverchannel.com/news/movie-theater-shooting/theater-shooting-trial-james-holmes-ex-girlfriend-gargi-datta-testifies-wednesday|title=Theater shooting trial: James Holmes' ex-girlfriend Gargi Datta begins to testify Wednesday|work=The Denver Channel|date=June 10, 2015|accessdate=June 10, 2015}}{{cite web|url=https://news.yahoo.com/theater-shooters-ex-didnt-see-future-him-071805977.html|title=Theater shooter's ex: 'I didn't see a future with him'|work=Yahoo! News|date=June 11, 2015|accessdate=June 11, 2015}} Holmes confessed to a state-appointed psychiatric physician that "their breakup contributed to his violent depression".{{cite web|url=http://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/theater-shooter-james-holmes-ex-girlfriend-he-liked-me-more-n373431|title=Theater Shooter James Holmes; Ex-Girlfriend: 'He Liked Me More Than I Liked Him'|date=10 June 2015|publisher=[[National Broadcasting Corporation]] (NBC)|language=English|accessdate=8 September 2016|quote=In the earlier video, Holmes told a state-appointed psychiatrist that he contracted mononucleosis in late 2011 and became depressed and lacked energy because of his subsequent breakup with his girlfriend. "My mind was kind of falling apart," Holmes told Dr. William Reid in the interview at a state mental hospital two years after the attack.}}{{cite web|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/news/national/james-holmes-ex-girlfriend-testifies-shooting-trial-article-1.2254303|title=James Holmes' ex-girlfriend testifies in trial for Aurora shooting: 'I think he liked me more than I liked him'|last=Silverstein|first=Jason|date=11 June 2015|publisher=[[New York Daily News]]|language=English|accessdate=8 September 2016|quote=Holmes professed his love for Datta and said their breakup contributed to his violent depression, in a filmed psychiatric interview shown earlier in the trial.}} ==Education and career== In 2006, Holmes worked as an intern at the [[Salk Institute for Biological Studies]] where he was assigned to write computer code for an experiment. Holmes, who was described by his supervisor as stubborn, uncommunicative and socially inept, presented his project to the other interns at the end of the internship, but never actually completed it.{{cite news| url= http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Latest-News-Wires/2012/0723/Colorado-shooting-suspect-James-Holmes-was-an-unusually-bad-intern | title= Colorado shooting suspect James Holmes was an 'unusually bad intern' |work= [[The Christian Science Monitor]] |date= July 23, 2012}}{{cite news| url= http://www.nydailynews.com/news/national/suspected-aurora-shooter-james-holmes-brilliant-a-long-shot-salk-institute-supervisor-john-jacobson-article-1.1120132 |title= Suspected Aurora shooter James Holmes brilliant? Not by a long shot, says former Salk Institute supervisor John Jacobson| newspaper= [[New York Daily News]] |date=July 23, 2012}} Holmes wrote of his experiences at the Salk Institute in a college application essay: "I had little experience in computer programming and the work was challenging to say the least. Nonetheless, I taught myself how to program in [[Adobe Flash|Flash]] and then construct a cross-temporal calibration model.... Completing the project and presenting my model at the end of the internship was exhilarating."{{cite web|last=Holmes|first=James|title=Resume submitted to University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign|url=http://graphics.thomsonreuters.com/12/08/Resume.pdf |publisher=Reuters|accessdate=August 11, 2012|page=11}} Graduating from [[Westview High School (San Diego)|Westview High School]] in the [[Torrey Highlands, San Diego|Torrey Highlands]] community of San Diego in 2006, Holmes attended the [[University of California, Riverside]] (UCR) and, in 2010, received his undergraduate degree in [[neuroscience]] with the [[Latin honors|highest honors]]. He was a member of several honor societies, including [[Phi Beta Kappa]] and [[Golden Key International Honour Society|Golden Key]]. According to UCR recommendation letters submitted to the [[University of Illinois at Urbana–Champaign]] (UIUC), Holmes graduated in the top 1% of his class with a 3.949 [[Grade (education)|GPA]]. The UCR letters also described Holmes as "a very effective group leader" and a person who "takes an active role in his education, and brings a great amount of intellectual and emotional maturity into the classroom".{{cite news|title=Man accused in Colo. shooting was accepted to UIUC|url=http://www.nbcchicago.com/news/local/Man-Accused-in-Colo-Shooting-Was-Accepted-to-UIUC-165807536.html|accessdate=August 11, 2012|newspaper=5 NBC Chicago|date=August 10, 2012}} In 2008, Holmes worked as a counselor at a residential summer camp in [[Glendale, California]], that catered to children aged 7–14. There, he was responsible for ten children and had no disciplinary problems.{{cite web|publisher=NBC News|first=Bill |last=Dedman |title=Photos of James Holmes, camp counselor for underprivileged kids |url=http://openchannel.msnbc.msn.com/_news/2012/07/21/12878372-photos-of-james-holmes-camp-counselor-for-underprivileged-kids?chromedomain=usnews&lite| date=July 21, 2012|accessdate=July 23, 2012}} In the fall of 2010, Holmes was employed at a pill- and capsule-coating factory in [[San Diego County]]. One of his coworkers said that Holmes was unsocial, and once acted strangely in a laboratory work station by staring at a wall and not verbally responding, only smirking when his coworker asked if he was okay.{{cite web|first=Keith|last=Coffman|url=https://news.yahoo.com/co-worker-recalls-colorado-movie-massacre-gunman-acting-170111355.html|title=Coworker recalls Colorado movie massacre gunman acting 'spaced out'|work=[[Yahoo! News]]|date=June 29, 2015|accessdate=June 29, 2015}} In June 2011, Holmes enrolled as a [[Doctor of Philosophy|Ph.D.]] student in neuroscience at the [[Anschutz Medical Campus|University of Colorado Anschutz Medical Campus]] in Aurora.{{cite news| url=http://www.lex18.com/news/shooting-suspect-was-graduate-student-at-colorado-medical-school |title= Shooting Suspect Was Graduate Student At Colorado Medical School | publisher=[[WLEX-TV]] | date= July 20, 2012}} He received a $21,600 grant from the [[National Institutes of Health]], according to agency records, which was disbursed in installments from July 2011 to June 2012. Holmes also received a $5,000 [[stipend]] from the [[University of Colorado, Denver]].{{cite news|title=James Holmes received thousands from grad-school grants ahead of deadly Aurora shooting|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-505263_162-57479463/james-holmes-received-thousands-from-grad-school-grants-ahead-of-deadly-aurora-shooting/|series=CBS This Morning|work=CBS News|accessdate=July 25, 2012}} Though Holmes received a letter of acceptance to UIUC, where he was offered a $22,600 stipend and free tuition, he declined their offer without specifying a reason. Reviewers of Holmes' application at UIUC remembered his application because he submitted a picture of himself with a [[llama]]. In 2012, Holmes' academic performance declined, and he scored poorly on the [[Comprehensive examination#Graduate|comprehensive exam]] in the spring. The university was not planning to expel him; however, Holmes was in the process of withdrawing from the university. Three days after failing a key oral exam at the university in early June 2012, Holmes dropped out of his studies without further explanation.{{cite news|last=Harris|first=Dan|title=James Holmes Bought Rifle After Failing Oral Exam at University of Colorado|url=http://abcnews.go.com/US/james-holmes-bought-rifle-failing-oral-exam-university/story?id=16850268#.UBDFcDG3CFc|accessdate=July 26, 2012|work=[[ABC News]]|date=July 25, 2012}} At the time of his arrest, he gave his occupation as "laborer."{{cite news|last=Sickles|first=Jason|title=Judge accused of creating ‘unusual shroud of secrecy’ in movie theater shooting case|url=https://news.yahoo.com/blogs/lookout/judge-asked-reconsider-gag-order-movie-theater-shooting-114639357.html|newspaper=Yahoo News|date=August 9, 2012}} ==Aurora theater shooting== {{main|2012 Aurora shooting}} ===Events leading up to the shooting=== Holmes' defense attorneys stated in a [[motion (legal)|motion]] that he was a psychiatric patient of the medical director of Anschutz's Student Mental Health Services prior to the Aurora shooting. The prosecutor disagreed with that claim.{{cite news|title=Colorado shooting suspect was a psychiatric patient|url=http://www.cnn.com/2012/07/27/justice/colorado-theater-shooting/index.html?hpt=hp_t1|publisher=CNN|accessdate=July 27, 2012|date=July 27, 2012}}{{cite news|title=Defense: Shooting suspect was seeing psychiatrist |agency=Associated Press |url=https://www.google.com/hostednews/ap/article/ALeqM5h_lDyz8m3VLePnk8xpv07zKCaFxg?docId=883953506ff04481b079fa76082223ee |accessdate=July 28, 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120730200236/https://www.google.com/hostednews/ap/article/ALeqM5h_lDyz8m3VLePnk8xpv07zKCaFxg?docId=883953506ff04481b079fa76082223ee |archivedate=July 30, 2012 }} Four days after the release of the defense attorney's motion, the judge required this information to be blacked out.{{cite news|last=Meyer|first=Jeremy P.|title=Holmes court document revised four days after its release|url=http://www.denverpost.com/news/ci_21204243/holmes-court-document-revised-four-days-after-its?source=googlenews|accessdate=August 1, 2012| newspaper= The Denver Post|date=August 1, 2012}} [[CBS News]] later reported that Holmes had met with at least three mental health professionals at the [[University of Colorado]] before the massacre. One of them, who was informed by Holmes of his homicidal thoughts, considered placing him on an involuntary mental health hold, but decided against it, noting her belief that Holmes was borderline and the commitment would only inflame him.{{cite web|url=https://news.yahoo.com/psychiatrist-colorado-movie-gunman-thought-mental-hold-might-024609685.html|title=Psychiatrist for Colorado movie gunman thought mental hold might 'inflame' him|work=Yahoo! News|date=September 2, 2015|accessdate=September 3, 2015|first=Keith|last=Coffman}} One of Holmes' psychiatrists suspected that prior to the shooting, Holmes suffered from a mental illness that could have been dangerous. A month before the tragedy, Dr. Lynne Fenton told the campus police that he had also made homicidal statements.{{cite news|title=Psychiatrist told campus police before Colo. theater attack Holmes had homicidal thoughts|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/national/colorado-judge-orders-documents-on-theater-shooting-suspect-released-after-media-request/2013/04/04/6b8ea7fe-9d74-11e2-9219-51eb8387e8f1_story.html|publisher=The Washington Post|accessdate=April 4, 2013|deadurl=yes}} {{Dead link|date=April 2014|bot=RjwilmsiBot}} Two weeks before the massacre, Holmes sent a text message asking a graduate student if the student had ever heard of the disorder [[dysphoric mania]], and warning the student to stay away from him "because [he was] bad news".{{cite news |url= https://www.nytimes.com/2012/08/27/us/before-gunfire-in-colorado-theater-hints-of-bad-news-about-james-holmes.html |title=Before Gunfire, Hints of 'Bad News' |work=The New York Times |first1= Erica |last1=Goode |first2=Serge F. |last2=Kovaleski |first3=Jack |last3=Healy |first4=Dan |last4= Frosch |date=26 August 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6BOiTyT0Z |archivedate=October 13, 2012 |deadurl=no}} Holmes was a fan of [[superhero]]es, including [[Batman]], and his apartment was even decorated with Batman [[paraphernalia]].{{cite news| url= http://www.latimes.com/news/nationworld/nation/la-na-colorado-shooting-sider-20120723,0,5449845.story |title= Profile of Aurora shooting suspect keeps getting murkier | newspaper= [[Los Angeles Times]] |date= 22 July 2012 |first1=Sam |last1=Quinones |first2=Kim |last2=Murphy |first3=Joe |last3=Mozingo}} Dave Aragón, an actor from the [[MTV]] television series ''[[Pimp My Ride]]'', stated that Holmes called him twice the month before the shooting took place. Aragón is the writer, director, and star of an upcoming film entitled ''The Suffocator of Sins'', which depicts a vigilante who shoots criminals, and Aragón claimed that Holmes showed interest in his movie's trailer.{{cite news| url= http://losangeles.cbslocal.com/2012/08/01/mtv-star-claims-alleged-aurora-theater-shooter-called-him-prior-to-massacre/ |title= MTV Star Claims Alleged Aurora Theater Shooter Called Him Prior To Massacre | newspaper= [[CBS]] |date= August 1, 2012|accessdate= December 26, 2012}} According to Arapahoe County District Attorney George Brauchler, Holmes chose the Century 16 theater for his attack because he liked movie theaters and the specific theater had doors that he could lock in order to increase the number of casualties, as well as being in an area where police response would take longer. He specifically chose to attack a midnight screening because he believed fewer children would be present, not wanting to kill them. Holmes allegedly considered other locations for a mass shooting, such as an airport, but ruled it out because an airport would have too much security. He also wrote his reasoning that an attack on an airport would be confused as an act of terrorism, saying, "Terrorism isn't the message. The message is, there is no message."{{cite web|first=Dave|last=Perry|url=http://www.aurorasentinel.com/news/aurora-theater-shooting-trial-day-1/|title=Aurora Theater Shooting Trial: Day 1|work=[[Aurora Sentinel]]|date=April 29, 2015}}{{cite web|title=James Holmes' notebook read to jury in Colorado movie massacre trial|url=http://www.cnn.com/2015/05/26/us/james-holmes-trial-notebook/|work=CNN|date=May 26, 2015|accessdate=May 26, 2015}}{{cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2015/06/01/colorado-cinema-gunman-pi_n_7487848.html|title=James Holmes Picked Midnight Movie To Avoid Shooting Children, Psychiatrist Says|work=Huffington Post|date=June 1, 2015|accessdate=June 1, 2015}} In addition, he had been considering using explosives, chemical agents, or biological agents in his attack, but rejected the scenario as he thought he might "blow himself up". Holmes had also considered serial killing as an option, but later reasoned it was "too personal, too much evidence, easily caught, few kills."{{cite web|url=http://www.cnn.com/2015/06/05/us/james-holmes-theater-shooting-trial/|title=A look inside the 'broken' mind of James Holmes|work=CNN|date=June 5, 2015|accessdate=June 5, 2015}} ===Actions prior to shooting=== On May 22, 2012, Holmes purchased a [[Glock 22]] pistol at a [[Gander Mountain]] shop in [[Aurora, Colorado|Aurora]]. Six days later, on May 28, he bought a [[Remington Model 870|Remington 870 Express Tactical]] shotgun at a [[Bass Pro Shops]] in [[Denver, Colorado|Denver]].{{cite web|first=Michelle|last=Castillo|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-201_162-57477014/colo-shooter-purchased-guns-legally-from-3-different-stores/|title=Colo. shooter purchased guns legally from 3 different stores|work=[[CBS News]]|date=July 20, 2012|accessdate=December 10, 2012}} On June 7, just hours after failing his oral exam at the university, he purchased a [[Smith & Wesson M&P15]] rifle.{{cite web|url=http://www.bellenews.com/2012/07/23/world/us-news/james-holmes-appears-in-court-being-accused-of-killing-12-people-in-aurora-cinema-shooting/ |title=James Holmes appears in court being accused of killing 12 people in Aurora cinema shooting | BelleNews.com, Latest News |publisher=Bellenews.com |date=July 23, 2012 |accessdate=October 7, 2012}} All the weapons were bought legally and background checks were performed.{{cite web|last=Moreno|first=Ivan|title=Police: Colo. Shooting Suspect Bought Guns Legally|url=http://abcnews.go.com/US/wireStory/police-colo-shooting-suspect-bought-guns-legally-16826588|work=ABCNews.com|publisher=Associated Press|accessdate=July 21, 2012|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120722041017/http://abcnews.go.com/US/wireStory/police-colo-shooting-suspect-bought-guns-legally-16826588|archivedate=July 22, 2012}} In the four months prior to the shooting, Holmes also bought 3,000 rounds of ammunition for the pistols, 3,000 rounds for the M&P15, and 350 shells for the shotgun over the Internet.{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2012/07/23/us/online-ammunition-sales-highlighted-by-aurora-shootings.html?pagewanted=all|title=Suspect Bought Large Stockpile of Rounds Online|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=July 22, 2012}}{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2012/07/24/us/aurora-gunmans-lethal-arsenal.html|title=Aurora Gunman's Arsenal: Shotgun, Semiautomatic Rifle and, at the End, a Pistol|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=July 23, 2012}} On July 2, he placed an order for a Blackhawk [[Assault vest|Urban Assault Vest]], two magazine holders, and a knife at an online retailer.{{cite web|url=https://www.google.com/hostednews/ap/article/ALeqM5jZOrGI5rTbxx_INDOf6khxDyuWwA?docId=d659ab1b80d4425d891c7d07aa568190 |title=Colo. shooting suspect used Internet for arsenal |work=Associated Press |date=July 23, 2012 }}{{dead link|date=June 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}} He also purchased [[spike strip]]s, which he later admitted he planned to use in case police shot at him or followed him in a car chase.{{cite web|first=Sadie|last=Gurman|url=https://news.yahoo.com/psychiatrist-childs-death-saddens-colorado-theater-shooter-170800641.html#|title=On video, theater gunman says killings got him 'value units'|work=[[Yahoo News]]|date=June 1, 2015|accessdate=June 1, 2015}} On June 25, less than a month before the shooting, Holmes emailed an application to join a gun club in [[Byers, Colorado]]. The owner, Glenn Rotkovich, called him several times throughout the following days to invite him to a mandatory orientation, but could only reach his answering machine. Holmes left Rotkovich one voicemail in reply. Due to the nature of Holmes' voicemail, which Rotkovich described as "bizarre", "freaky", "guttural", "spoken with a deep voice", "incoherent and rambling", Rotkovich instructed his staff to inform him if Holmes showed up, though Holmes neither appeared at the gun range nor called back. "In hindsight, looking back – and if I'd seen the movies – maybe I'd say it was like [[Joker (comics)|the Joker]] – I would have gotten the Joker out of it... It was like somebody was trying to be as weird as possible," Rotkovich said.{{cite web|url=http://www.foxnews.com/us/2012/07/22/massacre-suspect-james-holmes-gun-range-application-drew-red-flag-for-owner/|title=Massacre suspect James Holmes' gun-range application drew red flag|work=[[Fox News]]|date=July 22, 2012}} On July 19, just hours before the shooting started, Holmes mailed a notebook to his psychiatrist. The notebook detailed his thoughts and plans during the weeks preceding the shooting.{{cite web|url=http://abcnews.go.com/US/colorado-theater-shooting-trial-holmes-notebook-center-stage/story?id=31274856|title=Colorado Theater Shooting Trial: Holmes' Notebook to Take Center Stage|work=ABC News|date=May 26, 2015|accessdate=May 26, 2015}} The notebook was found in an undelivered package in the [[Anschutz Medical Campus]] mail-room.{{cite web|url=http://www.foxnews.com/us/2015/05/27/chilling-notebook-first-reported-by-foxnewscom-revealed-at-james-holmes-trial/|title='Chilling notebook' first reported by FoxNews.com revealed at James Holmes trial|work=FOX News|date=May 27, 2015|accessdate=May 27, 2015}} Immediately prior to the shooting, Holmes reportedly called a [[crisis hotline]] for mental health with the hopes that someone would talk him out of committing the massacre at the last minute. However, the call was disconnected after nine seconds.{{cite web|url=http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/nationworld/ct-james-holmes-murder-trial-20150602-story.html|title=Colorado theater gunman says he called crisis line before shootings |work=Chicago Tribune |date=June 2, 2015|accessdate=March 16, 2018}} ===Shooting and arrest=== [[File:The Century 16 theater in Aurora CO - Shooting location.jpg|thumb|Century 16 at [[Town Center at Aurora]], scene of the shooting|right]] On July 20, 2012, police arrested Holmes without resistance while he was standing next to his car behind the [[Century Theatres|Century 16]] theater, moments after the shooting. Holmes had snuck out an exit door, propped it open, and returned with weapons and other gear, setting off several gas or smoke canisters and then opening fire on the theater audience, killing 12 and wounding 70.{{cite web|url=http://www.cnn.com/interactive/2012/07/us/aurora.shooting/index.html|title=Timeline: Colorado theater shooting|work=CNN|accessdate=September 16, 2015}}{{cite web|url=http://www.foxnews.com/us/2013/01/10/officials-release-complete-list-injured-victims-in-aurora-massacre/|title=Officials release complete list of injured victims in Aurora massacre|work=Fox News|accessdate=January 19, 2015}} According to testimonies during the following trial, Holmes was initially "calm and detached" during the arrest, but became interested in watching the aftermath of the shooting after being placed in the back of a police car.{{cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2015/05/01/james-holmes-police-testify-theater-shooting-trial_n_7177430.html|title=Police Say James Holmes Was Keenly Interested In Aftermath Of Theater Shooting|work=Huffington Post|date=May 1, 2015|accessdate=June 1, 2015}} The responding officers recovered several guns from inside the car and the theater. Once apprehended, Holmes told the police that he had [[booby trap|booby-trapped]] his apartment with explosive devices before heading to the theater. Police later confirmed the presence of explosives in the apartment. ==Legal proceedings== ===Detention and pretrial court appearances=== Holmes was initially jailed at Arapahoe Detention Center, under [[suicide watch]].{{cite news| first1 = Matthew | last1 = Lysiak | first2 = James | last2 = Arkin | first3 = Larry | last3 = Mcshane | title = Aurora shooting suspect James Holmes jailed in solitary: 'All the inmates were talking about killing him' | url = http://www.nydailynews.com/news/national/aurora-shooting-suspect-james-holmes-jailed-solitary-inmates-talking-killing-article-1.1119173 | accessdate =July 22, 2012|newspaper= Daily News | location = New York | date = July 21, 2012}} He was being held in [[solitary confinement]] to protect him from other inmates, a routine precaution for high-profile cases.{{cite news|url=http://www.globalpost.com/dispatch/news/regions/americas/united-states/120723/james-eagan-holmes-will-appear-court-monday|title=James Eagan Holmes will appear in court on Monday|work=Global Post|date=July 23, 2012|accessdate=July 23, 2012}} Holmes made his first court appearance in [[Centennial, Colorado|Centennial]], [[Colorado]], on July 23, 2012, before Judge William B. Sylvester.{{cite news |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ui_-a0ipdEA |title=Watch Theater Shooting Suspect's First Court Appearance |author= |publisher=[[YouTube]] |date=July 23, 2012 |accessdate=July 23, 2012}} He was read his rights and no bail was given due to the nature of the charges. A mandatory [[protection order]] was issued by the judge. The judge appointed a [[public defender]]. Holmes said nothing and never looked at the judge.{{cite news|title=Formal charges coming in a week in Colorado shootings|url=http://news.blogs.cnn.com/2012/07/23/suspect-in-colorado-shooting-to-appear-in-court/|publisher=CNN|accessdate=July 23, 2012|date=July 23, 2012}} His appearance and behavior, which was described as "dazed"{{cite web|url=http://www.latimes.com/news/nation/nationnow/la-na-nn-aurora-shooting-james-holmes-court-20120723,0,3068345.story |title=James Holmes makes court appearance in Colorado theater shooting |work=[[The Los Angeles Times]] |date=July 23, 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120730001145/http://www.latimes.com/news/nation/nationnow/la-na-nn-aurora-shooting-james-holmes-court-20120723,0,3068345.story |archivedate=July 30, 2012 }} and "confused"{{cite web|url=http://www.detroitnews.com/article/20120725/NATION/207250335/Shooting-suspect-s-court-appearance-puzzles-many|title=Shooting suspect's court appearance puzzles many|work=The Detroit News|date=July 25, 2012}}{{dead link|date=January 2013}} fueled speculation about his mental state.{{cite web|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2012/07/24/justice/colorado-shooting-holmes/index.html|title=Court appearance fuels theories about Colorado shooting suspect|work=[[CNN]]|date=July 25, 2012}} Holmes was represented by the [[Colorado State Public Defender]].{{cite web|last1=Tenser|first1=Phil|title=Aurora movie theater shooting: Attorneys who'll be trying to prove James Holmes' guilt or innocence|url=http://www.thedenverchannel.com/news/movie-theater-shooting/aurora-movie-theater-shooting-attorneys-wholl-be-trying-to-prove-james-holmes-guilt-or-innocence|website=ABC 7|date=July 23, 2015|accessdate=July 23, 2015}} On July 30, Colorado prosecutors filed formal charges against Holmes that included 24 counts of [[first degree murder]], 116 counts of [[attempted murder]], possession of explosive devices, and inciting violence. The multiple charges expand the opportunities for prosecutors to obtain convictions. For each person killed in the shooting, Holmes was charged with one count of murder with deliberation and one count of murder with extreme indifference.{{cite web|last=Riccardi|first=Nicholas|title=Colo. Suspect Charges: Murder, Attempted Murder|url=https://news.yahoo.com/colo-suspect-charges-murder-attempted-murder-180843200.html|accessdate=September 19, 2012|author2=Banda, P. Solomon|date=July 30, 2012}} Holmes agreed in court to waive his right to a preliminary hearing within 35 days.{{cite news|author=John Ingold|work=The Denver Post| url=http://www.denverpost.com/breakingnews/ci_21191265/hearing-underway-man-suspected-killing-12-aurora-theater |title=James Holmes faces 142 counts, including 24 of first-degree murder |date= July 30, 2012 |accessdate= October 7, 2012}} On August 9, Holmes's attorneys said their client was mentally ill and that they needed more time to assess the nature of his illness. The disclosure was made at a court hearing in Centennial where news media organizations were asking a judge to unseal court documents in the case.{{cite news|last=Banda|first=Solomon|title=LAWYERS: COLO. SHOOTING SUSPECT IS MENTALLY ILL|url=|agency=Associated Press|accessdate=August 9, 2012}} On September 19, the prosecution filed a motion to add 10 new charges against Holmes and asked to amend 17 others. The additional charges would bring the total counts Holmes faces to 152.{{cite news|last=Ingold|first=John|title=Prosecutors seek to add 10 charges against theater shooting suspect|url=http://www.denverpost.com/breakingnews/ci_21584139/prosecutors-add-10-new-charges-against-aurora-theater|work=The Denver Post|date=September 19, 2012|accessdate=19 September 2012}} Holmes appeared in the Arapahoe County Court house the following day for the first time without his dyed-red hair, but with cropped hair revealing his natural brown color.{{cite news|url=http://articles.nydailynews.com/2012-09-20/news/33982806_1_hair-james-holmes-prosecutors|author=Stephen Rex Brown|title=James Holmes has brown hair now|work=The New York Daily News|date=September 20, 2012|accessdate=September 20, 2012}} On September 28, court documents released by prosecutors say Holmes was revoked access to the [[University of Colorado]] campus because he threatened a professor. The university has said Holmes was denied access to non-public parts of the campus because he had withdrawn from school.{{cite news|title=Prosecutors: Shooting suspect threatened professor| author=Gary Strauss|date=September 28, 2012| url=https://www.usatoday.com/news/nation/story/2012/09/28/court-to-release-documents-in-colorado-theater-shooting/57850760/1?csp=breakingnews| work=USA Today|accessdate=28 September 2012}} On October 11, Holmes's attorneys asked Judge William Sylvester to postpone a preliminary hearing scheduled for November. On October 25, the preliminary hearing was set for the week of January 7.{{cite news|last=Coffman|first=Keith|title=Preliminary hearing in Colorado movie rampage case set for January |url=http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/sns-rt-us-usa-shooting-denverbre89o1mj-20121025,0,4281743.story|publisher=The Chicago Tribune|accessdate=25 October 2012|date=October 25, 2012}} Holmes' lawyers filed an emergency motion on November 14 to delay a pre-trial hearing, citing an unspecified condition that has left him unable to appear in court: "As a result of developments over the past 24 hours, Mr. Holmes is in a condition that renders him unable to be present in court for tomorrow's hearing." They requested to delay the hearing, which they received. It was rescheduled for December.{{cite news|title=Accused Colorado gunman cannot attend court due to condition: lawyer|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2012/11/14/us-usa-colorado-shooting-idUSBRE8AD1TE20121114|publisher=Reuters|accessdate=November 14, 2012|date=November 14, 2012}} Evidently, Holmes made various suicide attempts referred to as "half-hearted" in the days before the scheduled hearing on November 15.{{cite news|title=Colorado massacre suspect has made half-hearted suicide attempts|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-201_162-57550077/colorado-massacre-suspect-has-made-half-hearted-suicide-attempts/|publisher=CBS News|accessdate=November 15, 2012}} Holmes returned to court on January 7, 2013, at which [[9-1-1]] phone call recordings and videos from the cineplex were presented as evidence, information that up until then had not been released. Holmes' defense team continued to maintain that he was mentally ill.{{cite web|url=http://abcnews.go.com/blogs/headlines/2013/01/accused-colo-shooter-james-holmes-in-court/ |title=Accused Colo. Shooter James Holmes Hearing Set |publisher=Abcnews.go.com |date=January 2, 2013 |accessdate=January 7, 2013}} On that same day, it is reported that investigators seized four prescription bottles and immunization records from his apartment when it was searched in July 2012. It was not revealed what the prescriptions were or what they were for. The judge ultimately ruled in October that prosecutors could keep the items.{{cite news |url=http://www.denverpost.com/news/ci_22323293/aurora-theater-shooting-cops-took-pill-bottles-from |title=Aurora theater shooting: Cops took pill bottles from Holmes' apartment |publisher=''[[The Denver Post]]'' |date=January 7, 2013 |first=John |last=Ingold}} On January 10, 2013, a judge ruled that the evidence presented is sufficient for Holmes to face trial on all counts with which he has been charged.{{cite news|title=Judge rules James Holmes should face trial in Colorado massacre |url=http://www.foxnews.com/us/2013/01/10/james-holmes-not-ready-for-arraignment-defense-attorneys-say/|publisher=Fox News|accessdate=January 11, 2013|date=January 10, 2013}} His plea hearing was delayed until March 2013.{{cite news|title=Judge Delays Arraignment In Colo. Theater Shooting|url=http://bigstory.ap.org/article/colo-theater-shooting-case-enters-new-phase|work=Associated Press|accessdate=January 11, 2013}} On March 27, 2013, Holmes's attorneys said he would be willing to plead guilty to avoid the death penalty.{{cite news|title=James Holmes offers guilty plea to avoid death penalt|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2013/03/27/colorado-theater-killings-guilty-plea-offer/2025809/?csp=breakingnews|newspaper=USA Today |date=March 27, 2013 |accessdate=March 27, 2013|first1=Michael|last1=Winter}} On March 28, prosecutors said they were not ready to accept Holmes's offer to plead guilty and avoid the death penalty and also criticized the offer as a deliberate ploy by the defense in order to delay the start of the trial.{{cite web|url=http://denver.cbslocal.com/2013/03/28/prosecutors-criticize-holmes-guilty-plea-offer-call-it-a-ploy/|title=Prosecutors Criticize Holmes' Guilty Plea Offer, Call It A Ploy|publisher=CBS Denver|accessdate=January 19, 2015}}{{cite web|title=Prosecutors Not Ready to Agree to Holmes Plea|url=http://bigstory.ap.org/article/prosecutors-not-ready-agree-holmes-plea|work=Associated Press|date=March 28, 2013|accessdate=March 28, 2013}} On April 1, 2013, prosecutors announced they would seek the death penalty in a trial to start in February 2014.{{cite news|title=Death penalty sought for James Holmes; trial set for Feb. 2014|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2013/04/01/holmes-court-appearance-today/2041881/|publisher=USA Today|accessdate=April 1, 2013|first1=Trevor|last1=Hughes|first2=Gary|last2=Strauss|date=April 1, 2013}} On May 7, 2013, Holmes's attorneys filed their intent for him to plead not guilty by reason of insanity. He made this change in his plea on May 31.{{cite news|title=Attorneys: Holmes plans insanity plea in Aurora shootings|url=http://www.cnn.com/2013/05/07/justice/colorado-theater-shooting-trial/index.html|publisher=CNN|accessdate=May 7, 2013|date=May 8, 2013}}{{cite news|title=Holmes asking judge to change plea to insanity|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2013/05/13/holmes-insanity-plea/2154681/?dlvrit=206567|publisher=USA Today|accessdate=May 13, 2013|first1=Trevor|last1=Hughes|date=May 13, 2013}} On May 23, 2013, Holmes's attorneys called the state's insanity-plea rules [[unconstitutional]].{{cite news| url=http://www.denverpost.com/breakingnews/ci_23307332/james-holmes-insanity-plea-challenges-be-heard-court | work=Denver Post | first=Sadie | last=Gurman | title=James Holmes' attorneys say insanity-plea rules are unconstitutional | date=May 23, 2013}} On May 29, 2013, the judge ruled about the constitutionality of the laws for insanity-plea questioned by Holmes's attorneys, concluding that the laws are not in violation of the Constitution.{{cite news| url=http://www.denverpost.com/breakingnews/ci_23346976/aurora-theater-shooting-judge-finds-insanity-plea-laws | work=Denver Post | first=John | last=Ingold | title=James Holmes trial: Judge clears insanity plea's constitutionality | date=May 29, 2013}} On June 4, 2013, the presiding judge accepted his plea of insanity defense. On August 5, 2013, Holmes was transferred to the Colorado Mental Health Institute in [[Pueblo, Colorado]].{{cite web|title=Suspect Holmes at CMHIP|url=http://www.chieftain.com/home/1658935-120/holmes-chieftain-cmhip-shooting|publisher=The Pueblo Chieftain|accessdate=August 6, 2013}} By August 20, 2013, Holmes was no longer detained at Colorado Mental Health Institute;{{cite web|url=http://www.chieftain.com/home/1769151-120/holmes-pueblo-shooting-aurora|title=Holmes transferred from Pueblo's state mental hospital|work=www.chieftain.com|accessdate=January 19, 2015}} he was transferred back to jail.{{citation needed|date=July 2015}} ===Trial=== On February 27, 2014, Arapahoe County District Court Judge Carlos Samour set the start of Holmes' trial for October 14. However, the trial was delayed to December 8 upon a defense request for a continuance to further evaluate Holmes mental condition.{{cite news |url=http://www.denverpost.com/news/ci_25238865/new-trial-date-expected-aurora-theater-shooting-case |title=Judge sets October trial for James Holmes in Aurora theater shooting |work=The Denver Post |first=John |last=Ingold |date=February 27, 2014 |accessdate=February 28, 2014}}"[http://www.thedenverchannel.com/news/state-news/judge-sets-new-dec-8-trial-date-for-james-holmes Judge sets new Dec. 8 trial date for James Holmes]" ''The Denver Channel'', July 22, 2014. On that date, the trial was again postponed as Holmes' lawyers asked for another continuance to further prepare their case and review the paperwork of evidence.{{cite web|url=http://www.foxnews.com/us/2014/12/08/judge-could-consider-trial-delay-as-attorneys-in-colorado-theater-shooting-head/|title=Judge considering another James Holmes trial delay|work=Fox News|accessdate=January 19, 2015}} Jury selection eventually started on January 20, 2015, after a request by Holmes' lawyers for yet another continuance was denied.{{cite web|url=http://www.latimes.com/nation/la-na-james-holmes-trial-20150120-story.html|title=Jury selection gets underway in Colorado theater massacre trial|author=Los Angeles Times|date=January 20, 2015|work=latimes.com|accessdate=February 8, 2015}} The juror selection process lasted three months and [[Summons|summoned]] 9,000 candidates, making it the largest jury summons in U.S. history. On April 15, selection ended, with a total of nineteen women and five men serving. There were concerns about the selection of the jurors since at least two from the pool of twelve primary jurors, along with twelve alternatives, had ties to the 1999 [[Columbine High School massacre]]: "Juror No. 535", the aunt of a Columbine survivor; and "Juror No. 737", a man who was a student there at the time{{cite web|url=https://news.yahoo.com/details-emerge-about-jury-picked-for-colorado-theater-shooting-trial-192409225.html|title=Details emerge about jury picked for Colorado theater shooting trial|work=Yahoo! News|date=April 15, 2015|accessdate=April 15, 2015}} and also a former friend of [[Eric Harris and Dylan Klebold|the shooters]]. The trial began on April 27 with opening arguments by the prosecution explaining that Holmes intentionally went to the movie theater that evening with the deliberate intent to kill as many people as possible in a mass shooting spree. The defense opened up their argument by admitting all the facts that Holmes was indeed the shooter, but that he is mentally ill with severe schizophrenia and was never in control of his right mind. Starting on April 28, and over the next few weeks, prosecution testimony included various survivors of the massacre and the after effects it had on the survivors.{{cite news |url=http://www.latimes.com/nation/la-na-james-holmes-trial-20150428-story.html |title=James Holmes trial: 'It was a pool of blood my face was in ... somebody else's' |author=Maria L. La Ganga |publisher=Los Angeles Times |date=28 April 2015 |accessdate=28 April 2015}}{{cite web|url=http://www.9news.com/story/news/local/aurora-theater-trial/2015/07/14/closing-arguments/30123129/|title=Theater trial jury begins second day of deliberations|publisher=9News|date=July 16, 2015|accessdate=July 16, 2015}} On May 26, the notebook Holmes mailed to his psychiatrist hours prior to the shooting was presented as evidence. There had previously been intense debate as to whether the notebook was eligible as evidence and should be admitted, since it details Holmes' thoughts. Prosecutors argued the content in Holmes' notebook, which detailed attack plans, proved the shooting was premeditated, while Holmes' attorneys argued that his writing indicated his mental illness. On May 27, Dr. William Reid, a court-appointed psychiatrist who interviewed Holmes for a total of about 22 hours, testified that Holmes was mentally ill but legally sane, diagnosing him as having [[schizotypal personality disorder]], which is characterized by constricted behavior and difficulties relating to others. Reid and another doctor evaluated Holmes in December 2013, determining him to be legally sane, and that his mental illness did not prevent him from forming intent and knowing the consequences of his actions. Holmes's attorneys tried to call for a mistrial, saying that the jurors heard an unprompted opinion that complicated the legal standard for judging the sanity of a person, but the judge refused to grant the request.{{cite web|first=Dan|last=Elliot|url=http://m.sfgate.com/news/crime/article/Theater-shooting-prosecutors-build-case-that-6290916.php|title=Psychiatrist: Colorado shooter knew what he was doing|work=[[Associated Press]]|date=May 27, 2015|accessdate=May 29, 2015}}{{cite web|title=Colorado Killer James Holmes’s Notes: Detailed Plans vs. 'a Whole Lot of Crazy'|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/05/29/us/james-holmess-notebook-and-insanity-debate-at-aurora-shooting-trial.html|work=The New York Times|date=May 28, 2015|accessdate=May 29, 2015}} On May 29, videos of Reid's interviews with Holmes in 2013 were shown to the court. In the videos, Holmes described his social awkwardness and the violent, paranoid thoughts he had been having prior to the massacre.{{cite web|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/news/james-holmes-recalls-his-state-of-mind-before-colorado-shooting/|title=James Holmes recalls his state of mind before Colorado shooting|work=CBS News|date=May 29, 2015|accessdate=May 29, 2015}} He also stated his belief that he was being followed by federal agents at the time of the massacre and hoped they would apprehend him at the theater before he could act.{{cite web|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/news/national/aurora-shooter-james-holmes-loved-comedies-wanted-arrest-article-1.2240883|title=Aurora shooter James Holmes loved comedies, hoped feds would lock him away before killing spree|work=New York Daily News|date=May 30, 2015|accessdate=May 30, 2015}} According to him, he transitioned from suicidal thoughts to homicidal thoughts after becoming depressed from his breakup with Gargi Datta.{{cite web|url=http://abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/wireStory/latest-glitch-delays-video-theater-shooting-trial-31394400|title=The Latest: Holmes Says Depression Drove Him to Kill|work=ABC News|date=May 29, 2015|accessdate=May 30, 2015}}{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3103237/Dark-Knight-gunman-said-hoped-FBI-STOP-Colorado-theater-massacre-said-depressed-breaking-girlfriend.html|title=Dark Knight gunman said he hoped FBI would STOP him before Colorado theater massacre... and said his 'mind was falling apart' after breaking up with girlfriend|work=Daily Mail|date=May 29, 2015|accessdate=May 30, 2015}} On June 8, a second psychiatrist, Jeffrey Metzner, testified that Holmes was mentally ill but legally sane when he plotted and carried out the shooting, and that he suffers from [[schizoaffective disorder]]. He interviewed Holmes for a total of 25 hours.{{cite web|first=Keith|last=Coffman|url=http://mobile.reuters.com/article/idUSKBN0OO2J720150608?irpc=932|title=Second psychiatrist concludes Colorado cinema gunman was sane|work=[[Reuters]]|date=June 8, 2015|accessdate=June 8, 2015}} On June 9, the trial came to a standstill after three jurors were dismissed by the judge for violating their orders to not talk about news reports regarding the trial: "Juror No. 872", a white woman in her twenties or thirties with three children; "Juror No. 412", a white woman in her twenties or thirties who is employed with a mental health company; and "Juror No. 495", a white woman in her late twenties to early thirties. Juror No. 872 had begun discussions about sensitive details of the case with the other two jurors outside of the court on at least two occasions.{{cite web|url=http://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/james-holmes-trial-three-jurors-dismissed-after-talking-about-case-n372426|title=James Holmes Trial: Three Jurors Dismissed After Talking About Case|work=NBC News|date=June 9, 2015|accessdate=June 9, 2015}}{{cite web|url=https://news.yahoo.com/judge-colorado-theater-shooting-trial-190602101.html|title=Judge in Colorado theater shooting trial dismisses 3rd juror|work=Yahoo! News|date=June 9, 2015|accessdate=June 9, 2015}} Two days later, Holmes's attorneys requested the dismissal of a fourth juror after her brother-in-law was shot during a robbery the previous day, and other jurors had seen her crying. Judge [[Carlos Samour]] responded that he would consider it, and agreed to the motion by dismissing her on June 15. On June 17, a fifth juror was dismissed after Judge Samour was advised that she personally knew a wounded victim of the shooting.{{cite web|url=https://news.yahoo.com/theater-shooters-ex-didnt-see-future-him-071805977.html#|title=Theater shooter's ex asked him to see therapist|work=Yahoo! News|date=June 11, 2015|accessdate=June 11, 2015}}{{cite web|first=Keith|last=Coffman|url=https://news.yahoo.com/judge-dismisses-fifth-juror-colorado-movie-massacre-trial-154150131.html|title=Judge dismisses fifth juror in Colorado movie theater shooting trial|work=Yahoo! News|date=June 17, 2015|accessdate=June 17, 2015}} On June 19, the prosecution called as their last witness Ashley Moser, the mother of slain victim Veronica Moser-Sullivan, who was critically injured and paralyzed in the shooting. Afterwards, they rested their case.{{cite web|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/news/james-holmes-trial-prosecutors-wrap-up-case/|title=Woman who lost everything caps prosecution in Holmes trial|work=CBS News|date=June 19, 2015|accessdate=June 19, 2015}} On July 9, Samour asked Holmes if he would testify in court, and advised him of his rights to do so. Holmes chose not to testify.{{cite web|first=Paul|last=Verccamen|first2=Steve|last2=Almasy|url=http://www.cnn.com/2015/07/09/us/james-holmes-trial-aurora-colorado-movie-theater-shooting/|title=Movie theater gunman says he will not testify|work=[[CNN]]|date=July 9, 2015|accessdate=July 18, 2015}} On July 10, the defense showed two videos of Holmes' strange behavior in his jail cell. One video showed him running and slamming his head against the wall before sitting down, while the other showed him tethered to a bed while naked, attempting to cover his head with a blanket and then a sheet. Afterwards, they rested their case.{{cite web|url=https://news.yahoo.com/defense-colorado-theater-shooting-rests-165125159.html|title=Defense in Colorado theater shooting trial rests its case|work=Yahoo! News|date=July 10, 2015|accessdate=July 10, 2015|first=Dan|last=Elliott}} On July 14, closing statements were made following a delay that resulted when the defense claimed some of the images planned to be shown to the jury by the prosecution were improper. The judge ordered for some of the slides to be changed or removed, explaining that they misstated or exaggerated the evidence.{{cite web|url=https://news.yahoo.com/closing-arguments-begin-colorado-theater-shooting-case-072039653.html#|title=Lawyers in theater shooting trial make final appeals to jury|work=Yahoo! News|date=July 14, 2015|accessdate=July 14, 2015|first=Sadie|last=Gurman}} Jury deliberations began on July 15 and continued into July 16. ===Verdict and sentencing=== On July 16, after deliberating for over twelve hours, the jurors found Holmes guilty on all twenty-four counts of first-degree murder, 140 counts of attempted first-degree murder, one count of possessing explosives, and a sentence enhancement of a crime of violence.{{cite web|url=http://ktla.com/2015/07/16/james-holmes-jurys-choice-was-aurora-theater-massacre-murder-or-madness/|title=James Holmes Found Guilty of First-Degree Murder in Colorado Theater Mass Shooting, Shows No Reaction|work=KTLA-TV|date=July 16, 2015|accessdate=July 16, 2015}} They began deciding his sentence on July 22.{{cite web|url=https://news.yahoo.com/despite-quick-conviction-theater-shooting-trial-isnt-over-061044872.html|title=Holmes will join many other mentally ill inmates in prison|work=Yahoo! News|date=July 17, 2015|accessdate=July 17, 2015|first=Dan|last=Elliott|first2=Nicholas|last2=Riccardi}}{{cite web|url=https://news.yahoo.com/colorado-death-penalty-focus-massacre-trial-enters-phase-100915257.html|title=Colorado death penalty in focus as massacre trial enters new phase|work=Yahoo! News|date=July 22, 2015|accessdate=July 22, 2015|first=Keith|last=Coffman|first2=Daniel|last2=Wallis}} The court expected the sentencing phase to last for one month.{{cite web|first=Raquel|last=Villanueva|url=http://www.9news.com/story/news/local/aurora-theater-trial/2015/07/16/what-happens-after-the-verdict/30256653/|title=Sentencing phase to start next week|publisher=9News|date=July 17, 2015|accessdate=July 17, 2015}}{{Dead link|date=November 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} Holmes declined to make an [[allocution]] statement.{{cite web|url=http://www.thedenverchannel.com/news/movie-theater-shooting/convicted-gunman-in-aurora-movie-theater-shooting-will-not-speak-during-first-sentencing-phase|title=Convicted gunman in Aurora movie theater shooting will not speak during first sentencing phase|work=The Denver Channel|date=July 21, 2015|accessdate=September 3, 2015|first=Anica|last=Padilla}} On July 23, the jury ruled that Holmes acted in a cruel manner, was lying in wait, and ambushed his victims during the shooting, which constitute as aggravating factors. However, the jurors decided that Holmes did not intend to kill children when he opened fire.{{cite web|first=Maria L.|last=LaGanga|url=http://www.latimes.com/nation/la-na-james-holmes-phase-one-deliberations-20150723-story.html|title=James Holmes jury find aggravating factors exist, moves on to second phase|work=[[The Los Angeles Times]]|date=July 23, 2015|accessdate=July 23, 2015}} On July 27, Holmes' sister testified that her brother became withdrawn from the family after they moved from [[Salinas, California|Salinas]] to [[San Diego]] during his early teenage years. On July 28, Holmes' father pleaded for his son's life, stating that he is severely mentally ill and does not deserve to die, regardless of his crimes. He displayed photos of camping trips and family vacations with Holmes to the jury.{{cite web|url=https://news.yahoo.com/father-colorado-movie-gunman-pleads-jury-life-222131517.html|title=Father of Colorado movie gunman pleads with jury for his life|work=[[Yahoo! News]]|date=July 28, 2015|accessdate=July 29, 2015}} On July 30, Holmes' lawyers made a final appeal to the jurors, urging them to consider mental illness in his sentencing despite their rejection of the insanity defense used in the trial.{{cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/james-holmes-defense-make-final-appeal-for-mercy_55bac08be4b0d4f33a023f8c?|title=James Holmes Defense Make Final Appeal For Mercy|work=The Huffington Post|date=July 30, 2015|accessdate=July 31, 2015|first=Sadie|last=Gurman}} The appeal for clemency was rejected on August 3, under the basis that mitigating factors such as mental illness did not outweigh aggravating factors such as the number of casualties in the massacre.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-33763506|work=BBC News|accessdate=August 3, 2015|date=August 3, 2015|title=James Holmes moves closer to death penalty verdict}}{{cite web|url=https://www.theatlantic.com/national/archive/2015/08/aurora-theater-shooter-james-holmes-death-penalty/400367/|title=Why James Holmes Is a Step Closer to Facing the Death Penalty|work=The Atlantic|date=August 3, 2015|accessdate=August 4, 2015|first=Krishnadev|last=Calamur}} On August 7, Holmes was sentenced to life in prison without the possibility of parole after jurors failed to unanimously agree on a death sentence. One juror was opposed to sentencing Holmes to death due to his mental health issues, while two other jurors were uncertain.{{cite web|url=http://www.denverpost.com/theater-shooting-trial/ci_28601756/aurora-theater-shooting-jurors-begin-watching-gory-video|title=James Holmes sentenced to life in prison in the Aurora theater shooting|work=The Denver Post|date=August 7, 2015|accessdate=August 7, 2015}}{{cite web|url=http://www.denverpost.com/news/ci_28605338/aurora-theater-shooting-juror-one-juror-refused-death|title=Aurora theater shooting juror: One juror refused death penalty|work=The Denver Post|date=August 7, 2015|accessdate=August 8, 2015}} Formal sentencing began on August 24 and ended on August 26.{{cite web|last= Fieldstadt|first=Elisha|last2=Rascon|first2=Jason|url=http://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/aurora-movie-theater-shooter-james-holmes-be-sentenced-life-prison-n406276|title=Aurora movie theater shooter James Holmes to be sentenced to life in prison|work=[[NBC News]]|date=August 7, 2015|accessdate=August 7, 2015}} On August 26, Samour formally sentenced Holmes to 12 life sentences without the possibility of parole for the murder charges, and an additional 3,318 years for the attempted murder and explosives possession charges. In imposing the sentence, Samour stated for the record that it was "the intention of the court that the defendant never sets foot in free society again," and added that "the defendant deserves no sympathy."{{cite web|url=https://www.cnn.com/2015/08/26/us/james-holmes-aurora-massacre-sentencing/index.html/|title=U.S.Theater shooter Holmes gets 12 life sentences, plus 3,318 years |work=CNN|date=August 27, 2015|accessdate=August 27, 2015|first=Ann|last=O'Neill}} ===Restitution=== On December 4, 2015, Judge Carlos Samour ordered Holmes to pay $955,000 in [[restitution]] to the victims. The judgment ordered $851,000 of the restitution to be sent to the state victim compensation fund, and $103,000 to be paid directly to the victims.{{cite web|author=Wyatt, Kristen|url= http://www.cnsnews.com/news/article/colorado-theater-shooter-ordered-pay-955k-restitution|title=Colorado theater shooter ordered to pay $955K in restitution|publisher=[[Associated Press]]|date=December 7, 2015|accessdate=December 8, 2015}} ==Imprisonment== In September 2015, Holmes was moved to the [[Colorado State Penitentiary]] in [[Cañon City, Colorado|Cañon City]]. According to authorities, they have not determined what facility Holmes will be ultimately incarcerated at, but say it is possible he may be moved out of state due to his high profile.{{cite web|author=Coffman, Keith|url= https://news.yahoo.com/cinema-massacre-gunman-moved-colorado-state-penitentiary-005321238.html|title=Cinema massacre gunman moved to Colorado state penitentiary|publisher=[[Reuters]]|date=September 11, 2015|accessdate=September 13, 2015}} On October 8, 2015, Holmes was assaulted by another inmate, identified as Mark Daniels, who was convicted of auto theft. Daniels attacked Holmes after a prison guard inadvertently opened a gate separating the two of them; he struck Holmes twice before being subdued by prison staff. At the time, Holmes was not allowed interaction with other inmates. As a result of the attack, he was secretly transferred to an undisclosed location out of the state.{{cite web|url=http://abcnews.go.com/US/exclusive-inside-prison-assault-aurora-theater-shooter-james/story?id=37339691|title=Exclusive: Inside the Prison Assault on Aurora Theater Shooter James Holmes|work=ABC News|date=March 3, 2016|accessdate=March 3, 2016}} According to the inmate locator on the Federal Bureau of Prisons website, Holmes is currently incarcerated at [[United States Penitentiary, Allenwood |USP Allenwood]] in [[Gregg Township, Union County, Pennsylvania]].{{ cite web | url=https://www.bop.gov/inmateloc/ |title=Federal Bureau of Prisons Inmate Locator |accessdate=8 May 2018}} ==References== {{Reflist | colwidth = 30em | refs= {{cite news|work = UT San '''Jean Mansour''', SMSP<ref>[http://www.apostolische-nachfolge.de/asien2.htm]</ref><ref>[http://www.gcatholic.org/hierarchy/data/bishops-MAJ.htm#3089]</ref> (born on 27 July 1928 in Baalbek, Lebanon - died on 17 November 2006) was Bishop and administrator in the Melkite Patriarchate of Antioch.
==Life==
Jean Mansour was ordained to the priesthood on June 29, 1952 and became Chaplain of the Missionary Society of Saint Paul, a religious order of the [[Melkite Greek Catholic Church]]. On August 19, 1980 he received the appointment as auxiliary bishop and archbishop "[[pro hac vice]]" in Antioch with simultaneous appointment as Titular Archbishop of Apamea in Syria of Greek Melkites. The episcopal ordination was on October 19, 1980 by Patriarch of the Melkite Greek Catholic Church [[Maximos V Hakim]]. As co-consecrators assisted the Archbishops [[Nicolas Hajj]], SDS of Banyas and [[Habib Bacha]], SMSP of Beirut and Jbeil.
Between 1980 and 1997 Mansour was auxiliary bishop, he took mainly administrative functions. He was from 1997 to 2002 Curial Bishop in the Patriarchate of Antioch and at times patriarchal administrator. His broader range of tasks included the co-consecration of bishops, such as when [[Joseph Kallas]], SMSP, [[George Riashi]], BC, [[Boutros Mouallem]], SMSP, [[Fares Maakaroun]], [[Georges Kahhale]], BA, [[Salim Ghazal]], BS, [[Joseph Absi]], SMSP and [[Elias Rahal]], SMSP. On 17 October 2002 Archbishop Jean Mansour, according to age retired and was, until his death on 17 November 2006 Emeritus Bishop.
